page.title: 07Dartmoor Letterboxes
page.content: One hobby pursued by some on Dartmoor is searching for a{Dartmoor {Letterbox.}These are not red metal objects, but are rubber stamps contained in ammunition boxes or plastic boxes that are hidden on the moor. It may seem a daft hobby, but it is fun. In order to find one of the letter boxes, unless one is very lucky, one must have clues. These can vary from the explicit, such as the one of the box near Widgery Cross; "{From cross {go 125paces on 127 degrees to three {upright stones of hip height. Box is {10ft below." }to the clue for the { {Belstone Box; "15 yds below upright {stone on West side of the tor" { }Thus in order to find one of these boxes one must walk, navigate, and enjoy one of the beautiful parts of the British Countryside.
